text: Ana Matawhaura Hato was a singer from New Zealand of Maori descent. She along with Deane Waretini, Snr. have the distinction of being the first vocalists to have Maori songs commercially recorded in New Zealand. ==Background== She was born on 30 December 1907 in Rotorua. Her father was of Ngāti Whakaue descent, and her mother was of Tuhourangi descent. ==Career== Hato and her cousin Deane Waretini took music lessons from the wife of the Whakarewarewa School headmaster, Mrs Banks. Her and Waretini also sang at community gatherings, church and for tourists.tpo.tepapa.govt.nz Ana Hato (Ngati Whakaue and Tuhourangi) She made local history and an entry into the books in 1927 when she and Waretini performed for the Duke and Duchess of York. She was aged 20 at this time. This performance in Rotorua was recorded by technicians from the Australian branch of Parlophone Records. The recording was achieved with small portable acoustic recording equipment.Audio Culture Ana Hato, Profile ==Illness and death== She died at Rotorua on 8 December 1953 at the age of 45. ==Discography== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders sortable" |+ Singles (solo) |- ! scope="col" | Title ! scope="col" | Release info ! scope="col" | Year ! scope="col" class="unsortable" | Notes |- ! scope="row" | "Hoki Hoki" / "Te Arawa" | Parlophone A 2800 | | |- ! scope="row" | "Waiata Poi" (A Poi Song) / "Akoako o te Rangi (Whisper Of Heaven) | Parlophone A 2802 | 1927 | |- ! scope="row" | "In Fairyland" (A Maori Legend) / "Karo" (A Poi Song) | Parlophone A 2807 | 1927Audio Culture Ana Hato, Profile - Amana Mills | |- ! scope="row" | "Waiata Poi" / Te Taniwha (The Dragon), "Haka" | Parlophone AR 100 | 1927 | |- ! scope="row" | "Pokare Kare" / "Hine Ehine" | Parlophone AR 101 | 1927 | |- ! scope="row" | "Pokarekare" (The Ripple) / "Hine E Hine" (Slumber Song) | Parlophone R 3354 | 1927 | |- ! scope="row" | "Hoki Hoki Tonumai", "Poatarau Maori" / "Tahi-Nei Taru Kino", "Kutia Haka" | Parlophone R 3355 | 1927Discogs Ana Hato, Ana Hato Discography | |- ! scope="row" | | | | |- |} ==References== Category:1907 births Category:1953 deaths Category:New Zealand female singers Category:New Zealand Māori singers Category:New Zealand Māori women Category:20th-century New Zealand singers Category:20th-century women singers
